title: That the General Committee minutes of January 31, 2022 be approved.
That, pursuant to section 7 of Hearing Officer By-law 20-077, Lynn Marie Landry and Ted Horbulyk each be appointed as a Hearing Officer for the City of Peterborough.
That items 13.a.3, 13.a.4, and 13.a.5 be approved as part of the Consent Agenda.
That this Report be deferred to a future General Committee meeting.

That this Report be deferred to a future General Committee meeting. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report PKED22-001 dated February 14, 2022 of the Board Chair and President & CEO of Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development, as follows: That Report PKED22-001 and supporting presentation, providing the Peterborough & Kawarthas Economic Development 2021 Fourth Quarter Metrics be received for information.

That this Report be deferred to a future General Committee meeting. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report PKED22-001 dated February 14, 2022 of the Board Chair and President & CEO of Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development, as follows: That Report PKED22-001 and supporting presentation, providing the Peterborough & Kawarthas Economic Development 2021 Fourth Quarter Metrics be received for information. That Report PKED22-002 Peterborough & Kawarthas Economic Development 2021 Business Count Survey Project and presentation be received for information.

That this Report be deferred to a future General Committee meeting. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report PKED22-001 dated February 14, 2022 of the Board Chair and President & CEO of Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development, as follows: That Report PKED22-001 and supporting presentation, providing the Peterborough & Kawarthas Economic Development 2021 Fourth Quarter Metrics be received for information. That Report PKED22-002 Peterborough & Kawarthas Economic Development 2021 Business Count Survey Project and presentation be received for information. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report PKED22-003 dated February 14, 2022 of the Board Chair and President & CEO of Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development, as follows: That Report PKED22-003 and supporting presentation, providing the Peterborough & Kawarthas Economic Development 2022 Business Plan be received for information.

b) That, in consultation with Mayor Therrien or designate, Councillor Kemi Akapo be appointed to the Peterborough Physician Recruitment and Retention Committee; c) The Peterborough Physician Recruitment and Retention Committee become an independent steering committee and that the Memorandum of Understanding between the City of Peterborough, the County of Peterborough, and Greater Peterborough Area Economic Development Corporation (operating as Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development (PKED)) be amended to include hosting the funding for the physician recruitment services for the region. d) That the Mayor and Clerk be authorized to sign the amended Memorandum of Understanding. e) That funding from the City of Peterborough for physician recruitment efforts be redirected from the Peterborough Family Health Team to PKED. f) That Ms. Gomez be invited to appear as a delegate at the February 28, 2022 Council Meeting.

b) That, in consultation with Mayor Therrien or designate, Councillor Kemi Akapo be appointed to the Peterborough Physician Recruitment and Retention Committee; c) The Peterborough Physician Recruitment and Retention Committee become an independent steering committee and that the Memorandum of Understanding between the City of Peterborough, the County of Peterborough, and Greater Peterborough Area Economic Development Corporation (operating as Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development (PKED)) be amended to include hosting the funding for the physician recruitment services for the region. d) That the Mayor and Clerk be authorized to sign the amended Memorandum of Understanding. e) That funding from the City of Peterborough for physician recruitment efforts be redirected from the Peterborough Family Health Team to PKED. f) That Ms. Gomez be invited to appear as a delegate at the February 28, 2022 Council Meeting. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSFS22-005, dated February 14, 2022 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services, as follows: a) That the Mayor and City Clerk be authorized to execute an Agreement with the Innovation Cluster – Peterborough and the Kawarthas for a five year term from January 1, 2022 to December 31, 2026, on terms acceptable to the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services and in a form acceptable to the City Solicitor and substantially in the form attached as Appendix A to Report CLSFS22-005. b) That Mr. Skinner or a representative from the Peterborough Innovation Cluster be invited to the Council meeting on February 28, 2022, as a delegate

b) That, in consultation with Mayor Therrien or designate, Councillor Kemi Akapo be appointed to the Peterborough Physician Recruitment and Retention Committee; c) The Peterborough Physician Recruitment and Retention Committee become an independent steering committee and that the Memorandum of Understanding between the City of Peterborough, the County of Peterborough, and Greater Peterborough Area Economic Development Corporation (operating as Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development (PKED)) be amended to include hosting the funding for the physician recruitment services for the region. d) That the Mayor and Clerk be authorized to sign the amended Memorandum of Understanding. e) That funding from the City of Peterborough for physician recruitment efforts be redirected from the Peterborough Family Health Team to PKED. f) That Ms. Gomez be invited to appear as a delegate at the February 28, 2022 Council Meeting. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSFS22-005, dated February 14, 2022 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services, as follows: a) That the Mayor and City Clerk be authorized to execute an Agreement with the Innovation Cluster – Peterborough and the Kawarthas for a five year term from January 1, 2022 to December 31, 2026, on terms acceptable to the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services and in a form acceptable to the City Solicitor and substantially in the form attached as Appendix A to Report CLSFS22-005. b) That Mr. Skinner or a representative from the Peterborough Innovation Cluster be invited to the Council meeting on February 28, 2022, as a delegate That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSCLK22-005, dated February 14, 2022, of the City Clerk, on behalf of the Citizen Appointment Selection Committee, as follows: That Tracey Ormerod be appointed to serve as a member of the Age-Friendly Peterborough Advisory Committee with a term until December 1, 2023.
That this meeting adjourn at 8:00 p.m.
